page.title: 14HOME LIFE/DOMESTIC.Headcorn.
page.content: Home life in this part of{rural Kent } is in the main, comfortable - whether the home be a{Farmhouse, Cottage,}a {Family house}or a modern{Bungalow. {Electricity}is the major source of power for cooking and heating as there is no mains{Gas}supply in this area. Some homes do have{Bottled gas,}also other forms of heating like{Solid fuel or{Oil}are available. Cooking by an "Aga" or "Rayburn" oven is still done by some Housewives, especially for {Baking}and{Preserving. }Electrical appliances make housekeeping easier these days, and a{Freezer}is the usual method of preserving the locally grown fresh fruit and vegetables now. Modern {plumbing; wall-to-wall carpets; Double {Glazing}and{Loft insulation}are some of the improvements made to houses here in recent years.
